page.title: 05Housing in the Bookhams
page.content: High class housing covers most of the block. Since 1950 the population has grown very rapidly, encouraged by the road and rail transport to work places in London and the local towns. Every possible site has been developed or infilled and now there is virtually no spare land left, despite the pressure exerted by the new M25 motorway. Consequently, prices have soared; a house built in 1950 for less than Â£3000 now sells for Â£70-80000. Large detached houses are being built for Â£150000 and houses with 4/5 bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and double garages change hands for this sum. Semi-detached post war houses fetch Â£65000, 1930s terraced fetch Â£45000. Apart from leasehold flats, there is little available for less than Â£40000 and as a result many young house purchasers are forced to look elsewhere.
